Reference

timeternR

general package information

timeternR

timeternR: Ternary plot visualization for SIR curves (UPDATE)

data

Data included in package

pomp_arr

Example SIR simulation output of class 'array' from the pomp package

pomp_df

Example SIR simulation output of class ' data.frame' from the pomp package

pomp_pomp

Example SIR simulation output of class ' pomp' from the pomp package

pomp_sir

pomp_sir Example output from the pomp package.

EpiModel_agg_bd

EpiModel_agg_bd Example output from the EpiModel package for a individual model with birth and death rates.

EpiModel_det

EpiModel_det Example output from the EpiModel package for a deterministic model

EpiModel_icm

EpiModel_icm Example output from the EpiModel package for a stochastic ICM

hagelloch_agents

Measles in Hagelloch, Germany, 1861 (agent format)

hagelloch_raw hagelloch_raw2 hagelloch_aug_births

Measles in Hagelloch, Germany, 1861

hagelloch_sir

Measles in Hagelloch, Germany, 1861 (SIR format)

agents_sims

agents_sims Example output from SIR simulations

agents_sims_tidy

agents_sim_tidy Example output from SIR simulations in a data.frame format

fortify

Fortify functions

fortify_EpiModel.dcm()

Takes in output from the R EpiModel package in the dcm class and puts it in SIR format

fortify_EpiModel.icm()

Takes in output from the R EpiModel package in icm format and puts it in SIR format

fortify_agents()

Fortify agent data frame with columns when individual stops being susceptible and stops being infected (as well as initial state).

fortify_aggregate_ext()

Comments for Ben and Shannon

fortify_aggregate_ext(<data.frame>)

Takes in data from the R pomp package where the output is a data frame and puts it in SIR format for timeternR

fortify_aggregate_ext(<dcm>)

Take external aggregate data and put it in a format used in this package

fortify_aggregate_ext(<icm>)

Comments for Ben and Shannon

fortify_aggregate_ext(<list>)

Takes in data from the R pomp package where the output is a data frame and puts it in SIR format for timeternR

fortify_aggregate_ext(<pompList>)

Takes in data from the R pomp package where the output is a data frame and puts it in SIR format for timeternR

fortify_aggregate_ext(<pomp_df>)

Takes in data from the R pomp package where the output is a data frame and puts it in SIR format for timeternR

fortify_aggregate_ext(<pomp_list>)

Takes in data from the R pomp package where the output is a data frame and puts it in SIR format for timeternR

fortify_epimodel()

Generic method that takes in data from the EpiModel package and puts it in aggregate, SIR format

fortify_pomp()

Generic method that takes in data from the R pomp package and puts it in SIR format

fortify_sims()

Transform the array of simulations to a data frame

agents to aggregate

Method associated with transforming agents information to aggregations

agents_to_aggregate()

generalized method to convert raw agent based data to aggregate data

agents_to_aggregate(<data.frame>)

generalized function to convert raw agent based data to aggregate data

agents_to_aggregate(<grouped_df>)

generalized function to convert raw agent based data to aggregate data for grouped_data (preforms per group)

agents_to_aggregate_SIR()

Method for converting agent information to SIR format. Note this works differently on data.frame and grouped_df objects.

agents_to_aggregate_SIR(<data.frame>)

Convert agent information to SIR format

agents_to_aggregate_SIR(<grouped_df>)

agents_to_aggregate_SIR for grouped data frames

geoms and stats

Forward facing geoms & stats

stat_confidence_band() geom_confidence_band()

The confidenct_band geom/stat

geom_aggregate() stat_aggregate()

aggregate SIR path visuals from agent data

special functions

Special functions that make the package work

imports_hidden_from()

import hidden function / variable from other package

tidyr_new_interface()

logic to check if tidyverse (and tidyr specifically is up to version 1.0)

update_approved_layers()

Updates approved layers of ggtern

everything

EpiModel_agg_bd

EpiModel_agg_bd Example output from the EpiModel package for a individual model with birth and death rates.

EpiModel_det

EpiModel_det Example output from the EpiModel package for a deterministic model

EpiModel_icm

EpiModel_icm Example output from the EpiModel package for a stochastic ICM

GeomConfBand

GeomConfBand

GeomSirAggregate

GeomSirAggregate

SEIR_to_SIR_E()

Convert SEIR to XYZ coordinates fixed in a tetrahedron

SEIR_to_XYZ()

Convert SEIR to XYZ coordinates fixed in a tetrahedron

StatSirAggregate

StatSirAggregate

StatConfBandConvexHull

stat object for use in convex hull based stat_confidence_band and geom_confidence_band

StatConfBandDeltaBall

stat object for use in delta_ball based stat_confidence_band and geom_confidence_band

StatConfBandKDE

stat object for use in kde based stat_confidence_band and geom_confidence_band

StatConfBandSpherical

stat object for use in spherical ball based stat_confidence_band and geom_confidence_band

agents_sims

agents_sims Example output from SIR simulations

agents_sims_tidy

agents_sim_tidy Example output from SIR simulations in a data.frame format

agents_to_aggregate()

generalized method to convert raw agent based data to aggregate data

agents_to_aggregate(<data.frame>)

generalized function to convert raw agent based data to aggregate data

agents_to_aggregate(<grouped_df>)

generalized function to convert raw agent based data to aggregate data for grouped_data (preforms per group)

agents_to_aggregate_SIR()

Method for converting agent information to SIR format. Note this works differently on data.frame and grouped_df objects.

agents_to_aggregate_SIR(<data.frame>)

Convert agent information to SIR format

agents_to_aggregate_SIR(<grouped_df>)

agents_to_aggregate_SIR for grouped data frames

check_inside_elipsoid()

assert if observation is inside elipsoid

check_inside_elipsoid_func()

create a function assert if observations are inside elipsoid

check_min_max_time()

min_max_time vector check

check_ordered()

checks if states within data frame are ordered as inputted (<=)

delta_structure()

Performs delta ball approach

depth_curves_to_points()

Global Distance Depth pulling out data points from curves that are the most deep

dist_along_path()

Distance/angle between points along path relative to eculidean distance

dist_between_paths()

Distance between points

dist_matrix_innersq()

Calculates the distance matrix between a set of paths (Euclidean based). This is actually d^2

distance_depth_function()

Geenens & Nieto-Reyes functional distance-based depth

equa_dist_points()

point compression

equa_dist_points_listable()

List of compressions

expanding_info()

expanding aggregate data to desirable format

extract_contour()

Selection of specific contour level from KDE object

extract_icm_cols()

Extract the icm class totals

fit_kde_object()

Fit kernel density estimator (KDE) object

fortify_EpiModel.dcm()

Takes in output from the R EpiModel package in the dcm class and puts it in SIR format

fortify_EpiModel.icm()

Takes in output from the R EpiModel package in icm format and puts it in SIR format

fortify_agents()

Fortify agent data frame with columns when individual stops being susceptible and stops being infected (as well as initial state).

stat_confidence_band() geom_confidence_band()

The confidenct_band geom/stat

get_closest()

create a grid of points indicating near border or not (and inside or outside)

get_delta()

Find delta for covering

get_epimodel_icm_states()

Get the viable names for the states from an icm object

get_grid_elipsoid_containment()

create a grid of points indicating whether in a set of elipsoids

get_lines()

Get edges within union of balls

get_tri_matrix()

Make triangle matrix

get_xy_coord()

get xy ternary coordinates from xyz based data frame

imports_hidden_from()

import hidden function / variable from other package

inner_delta_ball_wrapper()

Run delta ball analysis

kde_from_list()

Contour of data points using Kernel Density Estimate.

Example SIR simulation output of class 'array' from the pomp package

pomp_sir

pomp_sir Example output from the pomp package.

project_onto_simplex()

Project onto a simplex where observations in the unit simplex x

project_to_simplex()

project onto a standard 3d simplex.

remove_delta_off_line()

Shorten line by delta on both sides

remove_incomplete_tri()

Remove triangles with edges that need removal

simulate_SIR_agents()

Simulate SIR data according to a chain Binomial

simulate_SIR_agents_groups()

Simulate SIR data according to many, independent chain Binomials

geom_aggregate() stat_aggregate()

aggregate SIR path visuals from agent data

state_change_inds()

Determine which agents changed states

step_along()

step along path

steps_along_2d_line()

Create n equidistance points

tidyr_new_interface()

logic to check if tidyverse (and tidyr specifically is up to version 1.0)

timeternR

update_agents()

Update agents based on Bernoulli draws
